conclusion: The problem asks to predict whether liquid from A, B, C, and D will flow into container E or F after passing through baffles.

The image shows four openings labeled A, B, C, and D at the top, with arrows indicating liquid flow downward. There are slanted baffles of various colors between the openings and two containers labeled E and F at the bottom.
Container E is on the left side and container F is on the right side, separated by a vertical divider.
The liquid from A, B, C, and D will follow the paths determined by the slanted baffles.
The combined streams from A, B, C, and D ultimately drain into container E.
